intro: Pycnanthemum ovatum, commonly known as sweet peppergrass, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It features aromatic, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in dense, spike-like clusters. Its medicinal properties have been recognized for their ability to soothe digestive discomfort. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodlands and meadows.
